Dating: 27TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before); 30TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Faience shabti
Description: A small, pale green glazed faience shabti. It has a plain back pillar and the inscription is in the 'T-shape', a single band of text with a column below, common from the 27th Dynasty onwards. The facial features are rough and the figure carries a hoe in one hand, an unidentifiable tool in the other. The wig is tripartite and a beard is worn. This shabti and number 49.8.35 belonged to the same owner.
